titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Valerian Platonovich Platonov Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ronald M. Bulatoff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-10-12T09:02-0700

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, and printed matter, relating to Russian governmental administration in Poland; political, economic, and religious conditions in Poland; and the Polish Revolution of 1863-1864. In part, microfilm from the Pilsudski Institute of America (3 reels). Collection material held at the Hoover Institution also available on microfilm (4 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Valerian Platonovich Platonov Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 36005

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms of Material Available
altformavail.p: In part, microfilm from the Pilsudski Institute of America (3 reels). Hoover Institution holdings also available on microfilm (4 reels).

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: In part, originals in: Pilsudski Institute of America

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Russian state secretary for Polish affairs, 1864-1866.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence arranged chronologically within the folder labelled Telegrams and alphabetically by last name of correspondent for the remaining folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, memoranda, reports, lists, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Kniaz' A. A. Shcherbatov (Prince A.A. Shcherbatov)
Stranichka iz Istorii Moskovskago Universiteta (A Little Page of History of the Moscow University), Prague,
Civil rights of Jews, report by Count Wielopolski,
Decree against unauthorized gatherings and public disturbances,
Mlawa Police Court case involving unauthorized gatherings and religious singing,
P[UNK]lock mayor's order to forbid unauthorized gatherings,
Polens letzer Aufstand (Poland's Latest Uprising), Leipzig,
Rys Ogolny Dzia[UNK]lan W[UNK]ladz Rzadowych Krolestwa Polskiego za Rok 1860 (Outline of the Activities of Government Authorities in the Kingdom of Poland for the Year 1860)
Special State Commission of Internal Affairs, excerpts from proceedings relating to taxation of peasants in private estates,
State Commission of Internal Affairs, taxation of peasants in private estates,
State Commission of Justice, record of complaints concerning illegal behavior of Russian military authorities in the towns of Suwalki, Radom, Kielce, and others,
Instructions on juridical and administrative litigations,
Towarzystwo Hypoteczne (Future Mortgage Bank) for Warsaw property owners,
District Criminal Court, sentence issued for disturbance case in the town of Boleslawiec,
District of Transport, accounts of road maintenance,
Proekt Gornago Ustava (Project of Mining Regulations),
Proposal for the establishment of an investigatory commission for political crimes in Poland,
Department Vneshnei Torgovli (Department of Foreign Commerce). Proekt Ustava Russkago Zemskago Banka (The Statutes of the Russian Zemstvo Bank), St. Petersburg,
Alexander II's decree regarding the establishment of provincial councils,
Instructions by the Russian government regarding education in Poland,
Instructions by the Russian government regarding government and political crimes in Poland
Zapiska podannaia v S. Peterburgskii Komitet o Pol'skikh Krestianakh, goda, chlenom A. Platonovym

odd.head: General note
odd.p: (Note presented to the St. Petersburg Committee, October 29, 1858, concerning Polish peasants, by member A. Platnov)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writings arranged alphabetically by subject and title.

did.unittitle: Mysl' po predmetu ustroistva i urovneniia na etom osnovanii pozemel'nykh sborov (A Thought on the Subject of Settling the Settlers and the Equalization of Tax Collections on this Basis),
Untitled manuscripts (in Russian) concerning peasants and land use,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous notes, lists, and parts of documents.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous notes, lists, and parts of documents
Papers of Valerian Platonov held by the Pilsudski Institute of America, relating to Poland,

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Finding aid available from the Pilsudski Institute of America: Walerian Platonow Papers, 1818-1879, Archival Fonds No. 084 http://www.pilsudski.org/portal/en/collections/archive/307-zespol-084
